==Events==
*[[1381]] &ndash; [[Peasants' Revolt]]: in [[Kingdom of England|England]], rebels arrive at [[Blackheath, London|Blackheath]].
*[[1418]] &ndash; An insurrection delivers [[Paris]] to the [[Burgundian (party)|Burgundian]]s.
*[[1429]] &ndash; [[Hundred Years' War]]: [[Joan of Arc]] leads the [[France|French]] army in their capture of the city and the English commander, [[William de la Pole, 1st Duke of Suffolk]] in the second day of the [[Battle of Jargeau]].
*[[1550]] &ndash; The city of [[Helsinki]], [[Finland]] (belonging to [[Sweden]] at the time) is founded by King [[Gustav I of Sweden]].
*[[1560]] &ndash; [[Battle of Okehazama]]: [[Oda Nobunaga]] defeats [[Imagawa Yoshimoto]].
*[[1653]] &ndash; [[First Anglo-Dutch War]]: the [[Battle of the Gabbard]] begins and lasts until [[June 13]].
*[[1665]] &ndash; England installs a municipal government in [[New York City]] (the former [[Netherlands|Dutch]] settlement of [[New Amsterdam]]).
*[[1758]] &ndash; [[French and Indian War]]: [[Siege of Louisbourg (1758)|Siege of Louisbourg]] &ndash; [[James Wolfe]]'s attack at [[Louisbourg, Nova Scotia]] commences.
*[[1775]] &ndash; [[American Revolution]]: [[British Army|British general]] [[Thomas Gage]] declares [[martial law]] in [[Massachusetts Colony|Massachusetts]]. The [[Great Britain|British]] offer a pardon to all colonists who lay down their arms. There would be only two exceptions to the amnesty: [[Samuel Adams]] and [[John Hancock]], if captured, were to be hanged.
*[[1776]] &ndash; The [[Virginia Declaration of Rights]] is adopted.
*[[1798]] &ndash; [[Irish Rebellion of 1798]]: [[Battle of Ballynahinch]].
*[[1860]] &ndash; The [[State Bank of the Russian Empire]] is established.
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]], [[Overland Campaign]]: [[Battle of Cold Harbor]] &ndash; [[Ulysses S. Grant]] gives the Confederate forces under [[Robert E. Lee]] a victory when he pulls his Union troops from their positions at Cold Harbor, Virginia and moves south.
*[[1889]] &ndash; Eighty are killed in the [[Armagh rail disaster]] near [[Armagh]] in what is now [[Northern Ireland]].
*[[1898]] &ndash; [[Philippine Declaration of Independence]]: General [[Emilio Aguinaldo]] declares the [[Philippines]]' independence from [[Spain]].
*[[1899]] &ndash; [[New Richmond Tornado]]: the eighth deadliest [[tornado]] in U.S. history kills 117 people and injures around 200.
*[[1922]] &ndash; At [[Windsor Castle]], [[George V of the United Kingdom|King George V]] receives the [[colour (flag)|colours]] of the six [[Ireland|Irish]] regiments that are to be disbanded &ndash; the [[Royal Irish Regiment (1684-1922)|Royal Irish Regiment]], [[the Connaught Rangers]], the [[South Irish Horse]], the [[Prince of Wales's Leinster Regiment]], the [[Royal Munster Fusiliers]] and the [[Royal Dublin Fusiliers]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; Shooting begins on [[Paramount Pictures]]' ''[[Dr. Cyclops]]'', the first horror film photographed in [[Technicolor#Three-strip Technicolor|three-strip]] [[Technicolor]].
*  1939   &ndash; The [[Baseball Hall of Fame]] opens in [[Cooperstown, New York]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: Thirteen thousand [[United Kingdom|British]] and French troops surrender to [[Major General]] [[Erwin Rommel]] at [[Saint-Valery-en-Caux]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[Anne Frank]] receives a [[diary]] for her thirteenth birthday.
*[[1943]] &ndash; Holocaust: [[Nazi Germany|Germany]] liquidates the [[Jewish quarter (diaspora)|Jewish Ghetto]] in Brzeżany, [[Poland]] (now [[Berezhany]], [[Ukraine]]). Around 1,180 [[Jews]] are led to the city's old Jewish graveyard and shot.
*[[1944]] &ndash; American [[paratroopers]] of the [[101st Airborne Division]] [[Battle of Carentan|secure]] the town of [[Carentan]].
*[[1954]] &ndash; [[Pope Pius XII]] [[canonization|canonises]] [[Dominic Savio]], who was 14 years old at the time of his death, as a [[saint]], making him the youngest un[[martyr]]ed saint in the [[Roman Catholic Church]].
*[[1963]] &ndash; [[African-American Civil Rights Movement (1955–1968)|Civil rights]] leader [[Medgar Evers]] is murdered in front of his home in [[Jackson, Mississippi]] by [[Ku Klux Klan]] member [[Byron De La Beckwith]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; Anti-[[apartheid]] activist and [[African National Congress|ANC]] leader [[Nelson Mandela]] is [[Nelson Mandela#Arrest and Rivonia trial|sentenced to life in prison]] for [[sabotage]] in [[South Africa]].
*[[1967]] &ndash; The [[Supreme Court of the United States|United States Supreme Court]] in ''[[Loving v. Virginia]]'' declares all [[U.S. state]] laws which prohibit [[interracial marriage]] to be [[Constitutionality|unconstitutional]].
*  1967   &ndash; [[Venera program]]: [[Venera 4]] is launched (it will become the first [[space probe]] to enter another [[planet]]'s atmosphere and successfully return data).
*[[1972]] &ndash; The fast food restaurant chain [[Popeyes]] is founded in [[Arabi, Louisiana]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; [[David Berkowitz]], the "Son of Sam" killer in New York City, is sentenced to 365 years in prison for six killings.
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Bryan Allen (cyclist)|Bryan Allen]] wins the second [[Kremer prize]] for a man powered flight across the [[English Channel]] in the [[Gossamer Albatross]].
*[[1987]] &ndash; The [[Central African Republic]]'s former Emperor [[Jean-Bédel Bokassa]] is sentenced to death for crimes he had committed during his 13-year rule.
*  1987   &ndash; [[Cold War]]: At the [[Brandenburg Gate]] [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Ronald Reagan]] publicly challenges [[Mikhail Gorbachev]] to [[tear down this wall!|tear down]] the [[Berlin Wall]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Russia Day]]: The parliament of the [[Russia|Russian Federation]] formally declares its sovereignty.
*[[1991]] &ndash; Russians elect [[Boris Yeltsin]] as the president of the republic.
*  1991   &ndash; [[1991 Kokkadichcholai massacre]]: the [[Sri Lankan Army]] massacres 152 minority [[Tamil people|Tamil]] civilians in the village [[Kokkadichcholai]] near the eastern province town of [[Batticaloa]], [[Sri Lanka]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; An election takes place in Nigeria which and is later annulled by the military Government led by [[Ibrahim Babangida]].
*[[1994]] &ndash; [[Nicole Brown Simpson]] and [[Ronald Goldman]] are murdered outside her home in [[Los Angeles, California]]. [[O.J. Simpson]] is later acquitted of the killings, but is held liable in [[wrongful death claim|wrongful death]] civil suit.
*  1994   &ndash; The [[Boeing 777]], the world's largest [[twinjet]], makes its first flight.
*[[1996]] &ndash; In [[Philadelphia, Pennsylvania]], a panel of federal judges blocks a law against [[indecency]] on the [[internet]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; Queen [[Elizabeth II]] reopens the [[Globe Theatre]] in London.
*[[1999]] &ndash; [[Kosovo War]]: [[Operation Joint Guardian]] begins when a [[NATO]]-led [[United Nations]] peacekeeping force ([[KFor]]) enters the province of [[Kosovo]] in [[Federal Republic of Yugoslavia]].
*[[2009]] &ndash; A disputed [[Iranian presidential election, 2009|presidential election]] in Iran leads to wide ranging [[2009 Iranian election protests|protests]] in Iran and around the world.
*[[2014]] &ndash; The [[2014 FIFA World Cup|FIFA World Cup]] take place in [[Brazil]].
